content.description:
An easy climb or solo, with great opportunities to place gear, make anchors, or do simul-climbing.   

  The large flake straight and halfway up is P2. 

  FA'd because all of the main dome was busy with other teams, and we got bored and wanted practice.
content.protection: .75"-3", and requires a body belay at the top of the dome as there are no bolts and not many places to build an anchor.  Sit inside a shallow bowl/shelf and body belay sitting down.
content.location: Right in the middle of the BBQ slab section, in between the large tree to the right and the pointy stack of rocks to the left.  Descend down the cave ravine to get back to the start, or summit the dome for and descend to exit.

content.description: A slabby section after the popular caving exit down the main dome.  A mix of 4th to easy 5th class climbing, with ample protection opportunities or easy free solos.  Looking at the dome from the trail, it is left of the Devil's slide area past the exit of the cave section (another 5 minutes or so of walking).  The area was named BBQ slab after it was determined that climbing it was the fastest way back from the dome to get back to the car and to Cooper's BBQ.
